item.title: A map of the district of Maine : drawn from the latest surveys and other best authorities

subject: united states
maine
maps
early maps
early works to 1800
results.title: A map of the district of Maine : drawn from the latest surveys and other best authorities

description: Shows county and township boundaries. Relief shown pictorially. Decorative title cartouche. Explanation provides symbols for the identified human features. "Taken by their order ; exhibiting the boundary lines of the district, the counties and towns, the principal roads, rivers, mountains, mines, islands, rocks, shoals, channels, lakes, ponds, falls, mills, manufactures and public buildings, with the latitudes and longitudes &c." "N.B. As the surveys of some towns were not so full as others the roads & streams of those towns have been unavoidably discontinued." From previous folder: The map of the District of Maine was issued in 1795. Editions were also issued in 1798, 1799, and 1802. Prelim. draft fo J.C. Wheat's "Maps published in America before 1800" contains note that Carelton sold maps only in 1795. He dates this map 1795. Stamped at bottom right: Map Division Library of Congress, Mar 23 1904. LC copy 1 imperfect: stained with losses along fold lines and mounted on cloth in 8 parts. Wheat and Brun 1978, 170. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

call_number: G3730 1795 .C32 Copy 2, stained with slight losses along fold lines and mounted in 4 parts; stamped in red
created_published: Boston : Published and sold by O. Carelton & J. Norman, [1795?]
notes: Explanation provides symbols for the identified human features.

"Taken by their order ; exhibiting the boundary lines of the district, the counties and towns, the principal roads, rivers, mountains, mines, islands, rocks, shoals, channels, lakes, ponds, falls, mills, manufactures and public buildings, with the latitudes and longitudes &c."
"N.B. As the surveys of some towns were not so full as others the roads & streams of those towns have been unavoidably discontinued."

From previous folder: The map of the District of Maine was issued in 1795. Editions were also issued in 1798, 1799, and 1802. Prelim. draft fo J.C. Wheat's "Maps published in America before 1800" contains note that Carelton sold maps only in 1795. He dates this map 1795.
Stamped at bottom right: Map Division Library of Congress, Mar 23 1904.
LC copy 1 imperfect: stained with losses along fold lines and mounted on cloth in 8 parts.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: Depths shown by contours and soundings. Title from map sheet no. 1. Black, red, and blue pen-and-ink on tracing linen. Includes 11 cross-sections and 2 tide registers. Map sheets individually numbered: No. 1 - 4. Production date varies by sheet from June 19, 1856 to July 25, 1856. Sheet no. 1 and 3: Traced by S. B. Linton. Sheet no. 2: Traced by Jno. A. Campbell. Sheet no. 4: Traced by Campbell and Hode. Sheets no. 3 and 4 have alternate statement: sent to Hon. John A. Dix. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Original version: [Washington, D.C.] : G. W. Hughes, 1843. vcFY24

medium: 1 manuscript map on 4 sheets : cloth, color ; 92 x 524 cm, sheets 92 x 131 cm

description: Pen-and-ink and water color on tracing linen. Accompanied by letter of transmittal to Superintendent of the Coast and Geodetic Survey, dated October 30, 1883 ; in envelope 31 x 23 cm "Copied Office of the Light House Board October 30th 1883." In red in on map and letter: M. Section VI. 60a. Stamped in red: U.S.C. & G. Survey, Library and Archives Mar 12 1902, acc. no. 917. Stamped in blue at bottom right: Coast & Geodetic Survey Office, Drawing Division Nov 5 1883." Includes field notes. Annotated on verso: May 24th 1883 acted on and adopted. LC copy imperfect: annotated and slightly stained. In ink on blue bordered label, 872 1883. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

description: Scale ca. 1:32,000. Relief shown by hachures. Prime meridian: Ferro. "To Sir William Young, Bart. ... this plan of the island of St. Vincent ... John Byres." Shows land granted to the Caribs, treaty boundaries, and boundaries of salable lands. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes explanatory text. Vault AACR2

location: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines--Saint Vincent
notes: "To Sir William Young, Bart. ... this plan of the island of St. Vincent ... John Byres."

results.title: Plan of the island of St. Vincent laid down by actual survey under the direction of the Honorable the Commissioners for the Sale of Lands in the Ceded Islands

description: Relief shown by contours. "To George Etherington Esqr. Lieutenant Colonel, in the 60th. or Royal American Regiment of Foot; This Plan of the Bequia is most respectfully Inscribed By His greatly Obliged, and most Humble Servant, John Byres." Includes text and indexed table of names of claimants as well as unclaimed land. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

location: Bequia Island (Saint Vincent and the Grenadines)
notes: "To George Etherington Esqr. Lieutenant Colonel, in the 60th. or Royal American Regiment of Foot; This Plan of the Bequia is most respectfully Inscribed By His greatly Obliged, and most Humble Servant, John Byres."
Includes text and indexed table of names of claimants as well as unclaimed land.

results.title: Plan of the island of Bequia laid down by actual survey under the direction of the honorable the commissioners for the sale of land in the ceded islands

description: Scale ca. 1:49,000. Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings. Cadastral map. "To William Hewitt ... for adjusting & settling the differences & disputes which have arisen or may arise with respect to the sale of lands in the ceded islands ... John Byres." Shows boundaries of salable lands. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes explanatory text. Vault AACR2: 100; 651/1; 700/1; 700/2

notes: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings.
